titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Agricultural Society of Kings County records 1977.396
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:20:03 +0000.

did.unittitle: Agricultural Society of Kings County records
did.abstract: One multipage document containing the Agricultural Society of Kings County's constitution, bylaws, list of officers, goals, dues list, and meeting minutes, dated March 1807.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Agricultural Society of Kings County was established by major landowners Jeremiah Johnson, Hendrick Lott, Leffert Lefferts, Jeremiah Lott, John Terhune, and John Vanderveer between December 27, 1806 and March 2, 1807. The focus of the Society was to promote agriculture, husbandry, and rural affairs.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Agricultural Society of Kings County records, 1977.396, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One multipage document containing the Agricultural Society of Kings County's constitution, bylaws, list of officers, goals, dues list, and meeting minutes, dated March 1807.
